title: Reaction from half reactions and Ecell

content.description:
Standard reduction potentials are shown in the table.

Reduction Half-Reaction
 <math alttext="E naught" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>E</mi><mi>°</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> at <math alttext="298 kelvin" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>298</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>K</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="P b with a positive 2 charge plus 2 electrons, produces P b" overflow="scroll"> <mstyle> <mrow> <msup> <mrow> <mtext>Pb</mtext> </mrow> <mrow> <mn>2</mn> <mo>+</mo> </mrow> </msup> <mo>+</mo> <mn>2</mn> <mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"> </mspace> <msup> <mrow> <mi>e</mi> </mrow> <mrow> <mo>−</mo> </mrow> </msup> <mo>→</mo> <mtext>Pb</mtext> </mrow> </mstyle> </math>
 <math alttext="negative 0.13 volt" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>0.13</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>V</mtext></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="C r with a positive 3 charge plus 3 electrons, produces C r" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mtext>Cr</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup><mo>+</mo><mn>3</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><msup><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo></mrow></msup><mo>→</mo><mtext>Cr</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>
 <math alttext="negative 0.74 volt" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>0.74</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>V</mtext></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>
content.question: Based on the information in the table, which of the following is a true statement with a valid justification?

choices.label: A reaction will occur when <math alttext="P b solid" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Pb</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>s</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> is added to a <math alttext="1.0 molar" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1.0</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>M</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> solution of <math alttext="C r, open parenthesis, N O 3, close parenthesis, 3" overflow="scroll"><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>Cr</mtext><mo>(</mo><msub><mrow><mtext>NO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></math>, because <math alttext="E naught" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>E</mi><mi>°</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> for the reaction is <math alttext="0.61 volt" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0.61</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>V</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>.

A reaction will occur when <math alttext="P b solid" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Pb</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>s</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> is added to a <math alttext="1.0 molar" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1.0</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>M</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> solution of <math alttext="C r, open parenthesis, N O 3, close parenthesis, 3" overflow="scroll"><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>Cr</mtext><mo>(</mo><msub><mrow><mtext>NO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></math>, because <math alttext="E naught" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>E</mi><mi>°</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> for the reaction is <math alttext="1.09 volts" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1.09</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>V</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>.

A reaction will occur when <math alttext="C r solid" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Cr</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>s</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> is added to a <math alttext="1.0 molar" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1.0</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>M</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> solution of <math alttext="P b, open parenthesis, N O 3, close parenthesis, 2" overflow="scroll"><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>Pb</mtext><mo>(</mo><msub><mrow><mtext>NO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></math>, because <math alttext="E naught" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>E</mi><mi>°</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> for the reaction is <math alttext="0.61 volt" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0.61</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>V</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>.

A reaction will occur when <math alttext="C r solid" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Cr</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>s</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> is added to a <math alttext="1.0 molar" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1.0</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>M</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> solution of <math alttext="P b, open parenthesis, N O 3, close parenthesis, 2" overflow="scroll"><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>Pb</mtext><mo>(</mo><msub><mrow><mtext>NO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></math>, because <math alttext="E naught" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>E</mi><mi>°</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> for the reaction is <math alttext="1.09 volts" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1.09</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>V</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>.

content.answer: A reaction will occur when <math alttext="C r solid" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Cr</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>s</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> is added to a <math alttext="1.0 molar" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1.0</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>M</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> solution of <math alttext="P b, open parenthesis, N O 3, close parenthesis, 2" overflow="scroll"><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>Pb</mtext><mo>(</mo><msub><mrow><mtext>NO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></math>, because <math alttext="E naught" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>E</mi><mi>°</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> for the reaction is <math alttext="0.61 volt" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0.61</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>V</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>.

skill.text: 6.D: Provide reasoning to justify a claim using chemical principles or laws, or using mathematical justification.
